member.name: T:MESharp.API.ActionOffsets
member.summary: Exposes well-known action offset routes from the native OFF_ACT table for scripted DoAction calls.

member.name: T:MESharp.API.Bank
member.summary: Provides access to the player's bank.
member.remarks: The Bank class allows for interaction with the bank, including checking if it's open, closing it, and depositing items.

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Bank.IsOpen
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the bank is currently open.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.Close
member.summary: Closes the bank interface.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.DepositAll
member.summary: Deposits all items from the inventory into the bank.
member.returns: True if the action was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.DepositAllExcept(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Deposits all items from the inventory into the bank, except for the specified item IDs.
member.param: The IDs of the items to keep in the inventory.
member.returns: True if the action was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.DepositAllExcept(System.String[])
member.summary: Deposits all items from the inventory into the bank, except for the specified item names.
member.param: The names of the items to keep in the inventory.
member.returns: True if the action was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.GetStack(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the stack size of an item in the bank by its ID.
member.returns: The stack size of the item.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.GetStack(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the stack size of an item in the bank by its name.
member.returns: The stack size of the item.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.DoActionById(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs an action on an item in the bank by its ID.
member.param: The index of the action to perform.
member.returns: True if the action was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.DoActionByName(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs an action on an item in the bank by its name.
member.param: The index of the action to perform.
member.returns: True if the action was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.DoActionInvById(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs an action on an item in the inventory while the bank is open.
member.param: The index of the action to perform.
member.returns: True if the action was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.GetItemsDetailed(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get detailed bank items with full metadata (stackable, tradeable, alchable, etc.).
member.returns: List of items with full metadata

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Bank.GetBankInventoryDetailed(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get detailed bank inventory items (inventory visible while bank is open) with full metadata.
member.returns: List of items with full metadata

member.name: T:MESharp.API.Equipment
member.summary: High-level Equipment API facade.

member.name: T:MESharp.API.Equipment.Item
member.summary: Represents a single equipment slot item.

member.summary: Get detailed equipment items with full metadata (stackable, tradeable, alchable, etc.).
member.returns: List of items with full metadata

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Familiar.GetItemsDetailed(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get detailed familiar storage items with full metadata (stackable, tradeable, alchable, etc.).
member.returns: List of items with full metadata

member.name: T:MESharp.API.Focus

member.summary: Register the managed UI thread so the native layer can coordinate focus spoofing.

member.summary: Register the HWND of the primary UI window created by the managed layer.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Focus.ActivateManagedWindow
member.summary: Attempt to bring the registered managed window to the foreground and give it focus.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Focus.SetFocusSpoofEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable the native focus spoofing shim.

member.name: T:MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard
member.summary: Helpers for sending synthetic key events to the RuneScape client.

member.name: T:MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.VirtualKey
member.summary: Windows virtual key codes for common keys used in scripts.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.KeyDown(MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.VirtualKey)
member.summary: Posts a KEYDOWN message for the requested key.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.KeyUp(MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.VirtualKey)
member.summary: Posts a KEYUP message for the requested key.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.HoldStart(MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.VirtualKey,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Starts a non-blocking key hold. If is provided the key will auto-release after that duration.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.HoldStop(MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.VirtualKey)
member.summary: Stops a non-blocking key hold for the requested key.

member.summary: Returns true if the key is currently held by the native helper.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.HoldStopAll
member.summary: Releases every key currently held by the native helper.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.HoldAsync(MESharp.API.Input.Keyboard.VirtualKey,System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Temporarily holds a key for the specified duration and releases it afterwards.

member.name: T:MESharp.API.Inventory
member.summary: Provides access to the player's inventory.
member.remarks: The Inventory class allows for interaction with the player's inventory, including checking for items, using items, and dropping items.

member.name: T:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item
member.summary: Represents one slot in the inventory.

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.Id
member.summary: Item Id

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.Name
member.summary: Item Name

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.Amount
member.summary: Stack count

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.Slot
member.summary: Slot index (0–27)

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.Exp
member.summary: XP (if any)

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.IsSelected
member.summary: True if this slot is currently selected in-game (use-on state).

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.IsNoted
member.summary: True if this inventory entry represents a noted variant.

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.IsStackable
member.summary: True if the item stacks naturally.

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.IsTradeable
member.summary: True if the item can be traded with other players.

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.IsBankable
member.summary: True if the item can be stored in the bank.

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.IsAlchable
member.summary: True if the item can be alched (and has a meaningful high alch value).

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.UseOn(MESharp.API.Inventory.Item)
member.summary: Use this item on another.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Inventory.Item.DoAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Do a menu-action on this item (1-based)

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.IsOpen
member.summary: True if the inventory UI is currently open

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.IsFull
member.summary: True if completely full

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.IsEmpty
member.summary: True if no items present

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.IsItemSelected
member.summary: True if an item is currently selected (e.g., for Use-on).

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.SelectedSlotIndex
member.summary: Returns the zero-based slot index of the currently selected item, or -1 if none.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Inventory.IsSlotSelected(System.Int32)
member.summary: True if the specified slot is currently selected (matches the selected slot index).

member.name: P:MESharp.API.Inventory.FreeSlots
member.summary: Number of free slots

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Inventory.GetAll
member.summary: Get every slot (empty or not).

member.summary: Find items by exact ID.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Inventory.FindByName(System.String)
member.summary: Find items whose name contains this substring (case-insensitive).

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Inventory.ContainsId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Check whether the inventory contains a given ID.

member.summary: Check whether the inventory contains any of these IDs.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Inventory.ContainsAll(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Check whether the inventory contains all of these IDs.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Inventory.ContainsOnly(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Check whether the inventory contains only these IDs (no others).

member.summary: Get the total count of an item by ID.

member.summary: Get the total count of an item by name.

member.summary: Eats the specified item by its ID.

member.summary: Eats the specified item by its name.

member.returns: True if the action was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:MESharp.API.Inventory.UseItemOnItem(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use one inventory item on another inventory item by their IDs. Example: UseItemOnItem(needleId, threadId) to combine them.

member.summary: Use one inventory item on another inventory item by their names. Example: UseItemOnItem("Needle", "Thread") to combine them.

member.name: T:MESharp.Exports.Exports_ScriptLoader
member.summary: Native exports for hot-reloadable script management. These functions are called from the C++ host to load/unload/reload scripts.

member.name: M:MESharp.Exports.Exports_ScriptLoader.LoadManagedScript(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Loads a managed script assembly into a collectible AssemblyLoadContext. The script must have a MESharp.ScriptEntry class with an Initialize() method.

member.name: M:MESharp.Exports.Exports_ScriptLoader.UnloadManagedScript
member.summary: Unloads the currently loaded script and releases file locks. After this, you can rebuild the script DLL.

member.name: M:MESharp.Exports.Exports_ScriptLoader.ReloadManagedScript(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Reloads a script (unload + load). This is the main hot-reload function.

member.name: M:MESharp.Exports.Exports_ScriptLoader.GetLoadedScriptInfo
member.summary: Gets information about the currently loaded script. Returns a string describing the loaded assembly, or empty if none loaded.

member.name: M:MESharp.Exports.Exports_ScriptLoader.GetLastLoadedScriptPath
member.summary: Gets the path of the last successfully loaded script. Returns null if no script has been loaded yet.

member.name: M:MESharp.Exports.Exports_ScriptLoader.IsScriptLoaded
member.summary: Checks if a script is currently loaded. Returns 1 if loaded, 0 if not.

member.name: T:MESharp.Native.Native_Runtime
member.summary: Native runtime control functions for managing the .NET host lifecycle.

member.name: M:MESharp.Native.Native_Runtime.GetShutdownEventHandle
member.summary: Gets the native shutdown event handle that can be monitored for runtime restart signals. This handle is signaled when ME wants to recycle the runtime.
member.returns: Win32 event handle (HANDLE)

member.name: M:MESharp.Native.Native_Runtime.IsShutdownRequested
member.summary: Checks if a shutdown has been requested by the native host. Non-blocking poll of the shutdown event.
member.returns: True if shutdown is requested, false otherwise

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.DefaultScriptRuntimeHost
member.summary: Default implementation of that proxies calls to while performing lightweight validation and path normalization.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.IScriptRuntimeHost
member.summary: Abstraction representing the managed script host lifecycle. Allows native exports and higher-level tooling to load, unload, and query the currently running script without binding directly to .

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.IScriptRuntimeHost.LoadScript(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the script from the provided path.
member.param: Absolute path to the compiled script assembly.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.IScriptRuntimeHost.UnloadScript
member.summary: Requests that the current script be unloaded.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.IScriptRuntimeHost.ReloadScript(System.String)
member.summary: Reloads (unload + load) the script from the provided path.
member.param: Absolute path to the compiled script assembly.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.IScriptRuntimeHost.GetLoadedScriptInfo
member.summary: Returns a human-readable description of the currently loaded script.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.IScriptRuntimeHost.GetLastLoadedPath
member.summary: Returns the path that was last successfully loaded, if any.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.IScriptRuntimeHost.IsScriptLoaded
member.summary: Indicates whether a script is currently loaded.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.NativeConsole
member.summary: Redirects output to the native ME logger so managed code can log before any script-provided SetLogger implementation runs.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.ScriptLoadContext
member.summary: Collectible AssemblyLoadContext for hot-reloading assemblies. When disposed, releases file locks on all loaded assemblies. Loads all assemblies from memory to avoid file locking issues.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.ScriptLoader
member.summary: Manages hot-reloadable script execution using collectible AssemblyLoadContexts. Allows reloading assemblies without restarting the native .NET runtime.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptLoader.LoadScript(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a script assembly into a collectible context.
member.param: Path to the script DLL (e.g., WPFScript.dll)

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptLoader.UnloadScript
member.summary: Unloads the current script and releases file locks.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptLoader.ReloadScript(System.String)
member.summary: Reloads the script by unloading and loading again. This releases file locks, allowing you to rebuild while the host is running.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptLoader.ScheduleContextVerification(System.WeakReference)
member.summary: Verifies that the AssemblyLoadContext was actually unloaded and file locks released.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptLoader.GetLoadedScriptInfo
member.summary: Gets information about the currently loaded script.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptLoader.GetLastLoadedPath
member.summary: Gets the path of the last successfully loaded script.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptLoader.IsScriptLoaded
member.summary: Checks if a script is currently loaded.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntime
member.summary: Public surface for configuring and accessing the managed runtime service container. Hosts (Orbit, standalone debuggers) should call before the first script load to register additional dependencies. Scripts can later resolve services via .

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntime.ConfigureServices(System.Action{Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection})
member.summary: Configures the service collection before the global provider is built.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntime.Services
member.summary: Gets the global service provider, building it on first access.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntime.GetRequiredService``1
member.summary: Resolves a required service from the global provider.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHost
member.summary: Provides a tiny runtime that wires the required MESharp entry points to a simple async delegate.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHost.Run(System.Func{System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHostOptions)
member.summary: Starts the script loop if it is not already running.
member.param: User code to execute until the cancellation token is triggered.
Optional configuration for logging and timeouts.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHost.Stop
member.summary: Cancels the script loop and waits (with timeout) for it to finish.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHost.SetLogger(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Redirects and to the native logger provided by ME.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHostOptions
member.summary: Configuration for .

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHostOptions.ScriptName
member.summary: Gets or sets the friendly name used in diagnostic log messages.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHostOptions.ShutdownTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets how long to wait for the script task to stop once shutdown is requested.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHostOptions.AutoStartShutdownMonitor
member.summary: Gets or sets whether should call automatically.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.ScriptRuntimeHostOptions.LogTransitions
member.summary: Gets or sets whether lifecycle events are written to the console.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.ServiceRegistry
member.summary: Central service registry for the managed runtime. Scripts and exports can use this to resolve shared services or extend the container before the first resolution occurs.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.ServiceRegistry.Services
member.summary: Gets the global service provider, building it on first access. Additional service registrations should be supplied via before the first call to this property.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ServiceRegistry.Configure(System.Action{Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection})
member.summary: Allows callers to augment the default service registration before the container is built. Invocations after the provider has been created will throw.
member.param: Callback that receives the service collection.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ServiceRegistry.GetRequiredService``1
member.summary: Resolves the requested service from the global provider.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.ShutdownMonitor
member.summary: Monitors the native host for shutdown signals and propagates them via CancellationToken. Use this to gracefully handle runtime restarts in your scripts.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.ShutdownMonitor.Token
member.summary: CancellationToken that will be canceled when the native host requests shutdown. Pass this to long-running operations, timers, and UI loops for graceful cleanup.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ShutdownMonitor.StartMonitoring
member.summary: Starts monitoring for shutdown signals from the native host. Call this early in your application startup (e.g., in App.OnStartup for WPF).

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ShutdownMonitor.Reset
member.summary: Resets the CancellationTokenSource. Call this after a successful restart to prepare for the next shutdown cycle.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ShutdownMonitor.RequestShutdown
member.summary: Signals the current CancellationToken as if the native host requested shutdown. Use this when a managed reload is initiated without a native restart.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.ShutdownMonitor.IsShutdownRequested
member.summary: Checks if shutdown has been requested (non-blocking). Useful for polling in tight loops.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.UiScriptHostOptions
member.summary: Configuration shared by the WinForms and WPF UI script hosts.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.UiScriptHostOptions.ScriptName
member.summary: Friendly name used in log output.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.UiScriptHostOptions.UiReadyTimeout
member.summary: Maximum duration to wait for the UI thread to report its ready state.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.UiScriptHostOptions.ShutdownTimeout
member.summary: Maximum duration to wait for the UI thread to exit during shutdown.

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.UiScriptHostOptions.AutoStartShutdownMonitor
member.summary: Whether the host should automatically start .

member.name: P:MESharp.Services.UiScriptHostOptions.LogTransitions
member.summary: Whether lifecycle transitions should be logged to the console.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.WinFormsScriptHost
member.summary: Hosts a WinForms window on a dedicated STA thread while integrating with the MESharp shutdown lifecycle.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.WinFormsScriptHost.Run(System.Func{System.Windows.Forms.Form},MESharp.Services.UiScriptHostOptions)
member.summary: Starts the WinForms UI if it is not already running.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.WinFormsScriptHost.Stop(System.String)
member.summary: Requests the UI thread to exit and waits (with timeout) for it to finish.

member.name: T:MESharp.Services.WpfScriptHost
member.summary: Hosts a WPF window on a dedicated STA thread while respecting MESharp's reload lifecycle.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.WpfScriptHost.Run(System.Func{System.Windows.Window},MESharp.Services.UiScriptHostOptions)
member.summary: Bootstraps the WPF window if it is not already running.

member.name: M:MESharp.Services.WpfScriptHost.Stop(System.String)
member.summary: Requests the WPF UI to close and waits (with timeout) for the UI thread to exit.
